WRITING.TITLE: What would be the best race + class combo for sword and board tank?
WRITING.TEXT:
I enjoy the sword and board heavily armored look in games. It is fun to think of my character as a wall of righteousness.
What race + class combo would best fit this? Also perhaps a link to a guide if possible :)
Aah, great to hear that it is playable with 250 ping. Wont be PVP'ing much but plan on maybe tanking some.

WRITING.TITLE: How reliant on low latency is the combat?
WRITING.TEXT: Is the combat real time or do most instant skills have like a 1.5s global cooldown similar to WoW that sort of helps with latency?

WRITING.TITLE: If I buy only the base game now?
WRITING.TEXT:
How long will it take before I start missing out on the DLC packs? Or are the DLC packs only of value once you hit max level?
So would the following make sense?
1. Buy base game for PC now.
2. Level to max level as Nord tank.
3. As soon as I hit max level (perhaps next month somewhere?) subscribe as an eso+ subscriber and get all the DLC plus other stuff.
Or is it better to just bite the bullet and get the Gold edition from the start? How much would future DLCs costs? Also how frequently are they released?
Great links thanks. Love the MegaServer technology.

But the Hutts?

Which distro?
Thanks
Great, thanks for this. How do you know that you have maxed out the relationship?

Do the romance also pick up from where it left off? I am in the same boat here, currently level 67 but only starting chapter 3. I am hesitant to go to kotfe / kotee due to losing my companion and our relationship ;)
Pure white crystals are very hard to come by though.
Excellent post! Thank you very much.
Thanks

I agree 100% with you. I personally have had this happened to me when asking a question due to being very new to the game (been playing for two weeks now).
But there are also some genuinely good very helpful folks on this sub reddit as well.
I really don't understand the reason for the down votes though.
Sure we can Google some info, but the thing is the game changed so much from version 1.0 to now that it is difficult to find up to date info on the web. So this leads one then to believe that asking on this sub reddit is a sane way of getting up to date info, it is the only SWTOR reddit after all :)

Thanks for the information.
No, there are a lot of people having this issue, me included. There has been at least 4 threads with multiple replies of people experiencing this on this sub reddit since the launch of 5.0

Keybindings and UI changes will safe if you do a log out to log in screen.
I also have to alt+f4 the game to exit it, but I found my settings are kept if I first just log out to the select screen before force closing.
What would be the best crafting skill to craft augments? Synthweaving?
Thanks
Excellent, thanks for the tip :)

WRITING.TITLE: How is the selling price in the GTN calculated?
WRITING.TEXT:
For instance an item is selling on the GTN for 200 credits lowest price per item. Dragging the item from my inventory to the sell box the auto calculated selling price is 350 credits.
Does this mean that I will get more by vendoring the item or is that calculated price not the vendor price?
Thanks very much, I will definitely check them out
Not replying to your questions but to your numbering scheme. Are you a programmer by any chance? Indexing from 0 and not 1
Thanks, will definitely jump in and give it a good shot :)
Thanks for the thorough reply.

The reason why two years from now matters is that from a newbie perspective it is very easy to get the feeling that the game is at the end of its life now and that everybody and their dog is unsubbing after this last expansion.
Being a newbie to the game also implies being a newbie to the community. If this naysaying is in fact typical of this community and thus do not actually represent the state of the game, then it is worthwhile investing time and energy in to the game.
I don't want to level to max level and get attached to my characters, enjoy the game, only to find out the servers are shutting down next month.
From a person new to this game, this is really the impression one gets from the community. People are either saying the game will die or wishing it does to spite BW (very weird to cut your nose off to spite your face :))

Thanks for the thorough reply. One definitely gets 'burned out' on MMOs after a couple of years with any one of them. Even though Legion is awesome, I had my fill of WoW over the last 5 years or so.
Reading the forum and Reddit for SWTOR though provides a disproportionate feeling that this game must be the worst ever produced. I know I am only level 58 now but I am failing to see this in the game I am playing. There is so much story and reasons to do quests in SWTOR (very little quests are of the type "kill 10 of those or bring 15 of these type of typical MMO quests)
So yeah, my question is basically then, where is all this bad that everyone seems to want to cancel their subs over and despises BW for? Guess I need to get to end game progression to see it (not that that is where I necessarily want to go, more like casual raiding and RPing is where I see myself).

"Safe" would be that the servers will still be up for a few years to come, and that there are people around to interact with, either by doing group content or RPing.
I don't mind paying for the privilege of having access to entertainment I enjoy. Actually, I feel 'bad' playing with out subbing. Nothing in this world is free and if I get a couple of hours of joy and escapism from SWTOR a week then I want to pay the devs and people hosting the servers for providing me with the opportunity to do so. If I don't, how can I aspect them to continue to invest in the product so that I can still enjoy it with new content a few years from now?
I really like the SW IP and MMOs, and if this is as good as it gets for SW at this point in time, then I really, really want SWTOR to succeed and be successful.

WRITING.TITLE: Why all the negativity, and is it 'safe' for a new player to start investing in SWTOR?
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi all
Why are there so many angry people with negative posts over here and on the official forums?
As a new player with an active subscription is it safe to start investing financially, emotionally and time wise in to this game?
Are these very vocal negative people in the minority and the game is actually doing OK at max level currently?
At this point I am level 58 and chapter 2 of the JK class story. Really enjoying it at this point in time.
Played WoW for a couple of years and would like to do some laid back raiding in SWTOR as well.
I like reading about the games I play as well and tend to get attached to my characters. Apart from this sub Reddit and the official forums, where can I find a bit more of a positive community?
Is SWTOR the only SW IP MMO currently?
Living in a semi arrid region of Africa, visiting one of the large Northern Hemisphere forests during fall is on my bucket list.

I recently (two weeks age) started playing and find this game absolutely awesome. I played all the old KOTOR and Mass Effect games as well as the Bioware first RPGs like Baldursgate, and the story and gameplay is SWTOR is like the KOTOR we never got.
Really don't know how I missed this game when it was initially released...
Anyway, download it and enjoy, try to stay away from the official forums and some posts on this Reddit sub forum though as it seems there a few extremely entitled toxic members in this community who have nothing positive to say about the game and is only wishing for its demise (very weird since they actually have an active subscription, because you need one to post on the official forums...).
I found a guild in game on The Red Eclipse - EU and have been having a blast with the folks in the guild.
There is a way to manually force bitraider to do a full check again, however it did not resolve my logout / exit bug.
Thanks :)
Great, thanks for the info.
Thanks, will do.
Thanks will look into it. What do you mainly do for farming credits?

I saw some of it on there. But man it is expensive 10M - 50M for a single slot on some armors.
I asume that these pieces on the GTN are from people who kept the items they got from the packs back in the day. Thus making the pieces very expensive due to their collectors status.
So my question is then actually, apart from the GTN and buying pieces people hoarded, are there any other means like playing the game, grinding and farming for them?

Thanks
I never alt+tab ;)
Then I get a black screen on launch.

Geforce 1070 and Windows 10 64 bit
thank you :)
Awesome transmog. Do you have an item list please?

WRITING.TITLE: Started a week ago and have some questions.
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi all
Installed the game and currently level 44 Jedi Knight. Loving it :)
While I am waiting for the patch to download I was thinking of asking some of the questions I have about the game.
Firstly, I subscribed to the game as it seems like the fair thing to do, the devs spend time creating it and I am enjoying it. Also I do not like to play with restrictions as my play time is limited and I would rather not waste it on grinding gold or other resources, but actually playing.
The questions I have are:
1. I got some Cartel packs, in these packs were orange coloured armours without stats. Are these only for transmog?
2. If I retrieve the item from my inbox item list and it becomes an item in my inventory, is that specific item only usable then on the character that retrieved it, or is it in your collection for any toon to create a copy off? If not, then I should be more careful to claim items on my JK I wont use due to RP / Lore reasons.
3. As a JK is it safe to romance Kira, I will not become a fallen JK for doing so and miss out on some JK specific quests / items? Like a fallen Paladin for instance loses his lay on hands abilities etc.
4. Is there any flying in the game, not in your spaceship but instead of hovering while travelling on a planet, actually take to the skies?
5. Should I keep my initial light saber casing I got on Tython and only upgrade it with mods, or can I sell it and use the better ones I pick up from mobs?
6. Are there any cool robes for a JK like the ones Obi-Wan wears? If so, what are they called and how can one farm / craft them?
Thanks to anybody / everybody who takes the time to reply :)
Thanks, great reply.

Yeah, I get that. For the story to progress you have to pushed along. What I was referring to (reading my post again not clearly though :) ) however is that for example a Jedi is somewhat 'forced' to act in certain way by the Jedi code. It won't make much sense (would be out of character and feel wrong) for a Jedi to make personal gain choices instead of helping others choices. Even if the option is presented in dialogue it would feel 'against' the Jedi Code to choose self gain over helping others. The other extreme would be to always have to choose the evil option.
So the question actually is then, which characters have the least restriction on the morality of their choices based on Star Wars cannon and lore?

WRITING.TITLE: Which playable character combination answers only to him/her self?
WRITING.TEXT:
New to the game, and have been thinking what type of character I want to create.
Which playable character combination answers only to him/her self?
I would think that this would be a trait linked to the dark side, but is it really so?
To be a Jedi, you need to follow the counsel as far as possible unless they give orders contradicting the Jedi code (killing of innocents for example).
So, if i want to play a character that truly does what it wants without answering to any one, would I need to play a Sith Warrior for example? Being a Sith Warrior does not imply being Chaotic Evil does it?
Edit:
I get that the game has to have some mechanism to progress the story and as such all characters have to be 'pushed' along and 'guided as to what to do next'
What I was referring to (reading my post again not clearly though :) ) however is that for example a Jedi is somewhat 'forced' to act in certain way by the Jedi code. It won't make much sense (would be out of character and feel wrong) for a Jedi to make personal gain choices instead of helping others choices. Even if the option is presented in dialogue it would feel 'against' the Jedi Code to choose self gain over helping others. The other extreme would be to always have to choose the evil option.
So the question actually is then, which characters have the least restriction on the morality of their choices based on Star Wars cannon and lore?
Excellent, thanks. Is the Red Eclipse PVP or PVE? (at work now so can't go to the SWTOR site :))
